title: Meet the New Co-CEOs of WeWork
summary: Longtime insider Artie Minson and tech veteran Sebastian Gunningham to succeed charismatic co-founder Adam Neumann. WeWork's decision to replace co-founder Adam Neumann with two chief executives suggests a desire to establish both credibility and continuity by pairing an accomplished technology veteran with a longtime insider.

title: Teachers, Not Tests, Gave Him His Shot, 'Hamilton' Alum Says
summary: New York City Council committee's hearing on 'breaking the testing culture' comes as academic exams are under scrutiny. Anthony Ramos made an impassioned plea for less testing at a City Council hearing Tuesday, saying he rose from a struggling Brooklyn student to a musical actor in the Broadway hit "Hamilton" because some teachers saw beyond his poor test scores.

title: The Impeachment Congress
summary: House Democrats need to vote to authorize an official inquiry.. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Tuesday endorsed an official inquiry to impeach President Trump, and there is joy across Resistance America-at least for now. The decision guarantees that this will go down as the Impeachment Congress, with little to show beyond investigations into the Trump campaign and now the Trump Presidency.

title: Give College Athletes What They Deserve
summary: Are they already compensated? Or should they be paid more? Students debate.. Editor's note: This Future View is about paying college athletes. Next week we'll ask, "What can 16-year-old Greta Thunberg's rise to international prominence as a climate activist teach us about youth activism?" Students should click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before Oct. 1. The best responses will be published that night.

title: 'How to Be an Epicurean' Review: Revisiting the Pleasure Principle
summary: Explaining an ancient philosophic system-one often caricatured or oversimpliﬁed-and applying its lessons to the minutiae of daily life.. In the past decade or so, it seems, the wisdom of the Greeks and Romans has been consulted as much for its self-help value as for philosophical truth. In addition to the perennial life guidance of Marcus Aurelius' "Meditations," inspired by the teachings of the Greek Stoic thinkers, we have had Ryan Holiday's best sellers, including "The Daily Stoic." There is Rebecca Goldstein's "Plato at the Googleplex"and, earlier this year, "Aristotle's Way: How Ancient Wisdom Can Change Your Life" by the classics scholar Edith Hall. Now comes the unlikely star turn of Epicurus, who in Athens around 300 B.C. founded the school that bears his name. In "How to Be an Epicurean," Catherine Wilson, a Princeton-trained philosopher, seeks to spread his evangel.

title: Hunters Point Library Opens in Queens
summary: Resume Subscription. The Hunters Point Library in the Hunters Point neighborhood of Queens opened after nearly a decade of planning on Tuesday.

title: British Government Goes Rogue
summary: A 'dead' Constitution looks good compared to Britain's 'living' version.. America's written Constitution gets a bad rap for being insufficiently adaptable. But not a few Britons might wish they had something similar as a legal decision Tuesday sent British politics-and Brexit-into new chaos.

title: Europe Turns to Trump on Iran
summary: The allies endorse a renegotiation of the 2015 nuclear deal.. President Trump has squabbled with his European counterparts over Iran since he left the 2015 nuclear deal. But the tactical disagreements have obscured how much Berlin, Paris and London agree with Washington about the Iranian threat. Now Tehran's attack on the global oil supply finally has moved Europe toward the Trump position.

title: The Impeachment Process, Explained
summary: Congress has engaged in impeachment proceedings against a president three times before. The Constitution gives the House the sole power of impeachment, but it doesn't outline specifically how to get there. Congress has engaged in impeachment proceedings against a president three previous times.

title: Warren's Profligate Sop to Seniors
summary: She promises to lift Social Security beneficiaries out of poverty-at a price tag of $70,000 apiece.. It's a strange campaign season, loaded with fantastical promises of government handouts for health care, college and even a guaranteed national income. But Sen. Elizabeth Warren's Social Security plan takes the cake. With trillion-dollar federal budget deficits and Social Security heading for bankruptcy, Ms. Warren proposes to give every current and future Social Security recipient an additional $2,400 a year. She plans to finance her proposal, which would cost more than $150 billion annually, with a 14.8% tax on high-income individuals. If Franklin D. Roosevelt were alive, he'd surely wonder why anyone calling herself a Democrat would want to turn Social Security, his signature creation, into another unearned entitlement program.

title: Corporate Tech Spending Helps Lift U.S. Economy
summary: Indirect effects of increased productivity and higher-paying jobs play a role. The U.S. economy is getting a boost as companies pour money into software aimed at driving productivity and revenue growth, creating well paid jobs at the same time.

title: Don't Let Iran Distract From China
summary: Beijing's bid to dominate Asia is a far greater threat than anything Tehran can do in the Middle East.. The Trump administration is right to respond cautiously to last week's Iranian attack on Saudi Arabia. As the U.S. protects its interests in the Middle East, it must not allow its military focus to be wrested away from Asia.

title: Build the Wall but Let More People Through the Doors
summary: Our asylum system isn't working, but Trump is wrong on the economics of immigration.. What ever became of those caravans? title: There's a Better Way Than Impeachment
summary: How Democrats can respond to Trump's wrongdoing without overreacting.. Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced Tuesday that she would open an impeachment inquiry of President Trump. Although some of the facts surrounding Mr. Trump's call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky have yet to be nailed down, it appears that Mr. Trump has grossly abused the powers of his office and distorted American foreign policy in pursuit of personal political gain. Yet the evidence so far suggests that impeachment is not the best way to hold Mr. Trump accountable for these infractions.

title: 'Life Begins at Conception' Is Not a Racist View
summary: Missing from the response to Mr. McGurn's prescient admonition is any indication of awareness that pro-lifers are animated, not by racial preferences, but by a sincere, shared and oft-articulated desire to prevent living, judicially innocent individuals from being butchered.. Regarding the Sept. 16 letter from Planned Parenthood Federation of America's President and CEO Alexis McGill Johnson responding to William McGurn's "White Supremacy and Abortion," Main Street, Sept. 3: People who deny the humanity of the unborn child are strangers to the truth. In her "Woman and the New Race" (1920), Margaret Sanger, the founder of what eventually evolved into Planned Parenthood wrote: "Birth control itself, often denounced as a violation of natural law, is nothing more or less than the facilitation of the process of weeding out the unfit, of preventing the birth of defectives or of those who will become defectives." I do not see a great deal of subtlety or ambiguity there.

title: The '50s Social Contract, Run by White Men
summary: It is amusing to see Mr. Lemann and others on the left wax nostalgic about the U.S. economy in the 1950s when privileged, white, male technocrats in government colluded with privileged, white, male CEOs to generously share corporate profits with union employees.. Regarding Barton Swaim's review of Nicholas Lemann's "Transaction Man" (Bookshelf, Sept. 12): It is amusing to see Mr. Lemann and others on the left wax nostalgic about the U.S. economy in the 1950s when privileged, white, male technocrats in government colluded with privileged, white, male CEOs to generously share corporate profits with union employees and Washington tax collectors. The good ol' days ended when countries that were decimated during World War II recovered and their businesses began to clean corporate America's clock. By the 1970s, U.S. corporate leaders had to worry about profit margins, growth and shareholder value, and that is when "transaction man" climbed the ladder to squeeze unions and make money for stockholders.

title: The Late Paul Ingrassia Was a Class Act All Around
summary: Your editorial "Paul Ingrassia" regarding the renowned journalist omits one very descriptive word-scholar.. Your editorial "Paul Ingrassia" (Sept. 17) regarding the renowned journalist omits one very descriptive word-scholar. Paul was a regular visitor to and supporter of the National Automotive History Collection of the Detroit Public Library. Those of us who knew him in that capacity found him to be exhaustive in his research, fact finding to a fault, and always willing to share his profound knowledge with other automotive enthusiasts. Always the gentleman, Paul appreciated the efforts of the librarians and library associates who assisted him in his research. Always gracious, Paul never failed to acknowledge them in his works.

title: Doctors' Activism Should Focus on Treatment
summary: While they are worked up over gun violence and climate change, I think most of us would be more comforted if they focused on the 350,000 Americans the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports die prematurely at the hands of the medical profession each year-far dwarfing any deaths from guns.. I suppose I shouldn't be surprised by the soaring, self-congratulatory sanctimony of the letters "Social Justice and Educating Our Physicians" (Sept. 19) from physicians defending political activism under the guise of practicing medicine.

title: Germany Does Just Fine With Workers on Its Boards
summary: The idea of worker representation on large corporate boards isn't new, and is widely practiced in Europe.. Oh my! Let's be real. The idea of worker representation on large corporate boards isn't new, and is widely practiced in Europe. Last I checked, large German corporations were producing plenty of profits and not wanting for buyers of shares of their companies.

title: Cruises Without the Crowds

But not all cruisers have an affinity for megaships and limbo contests on the lido deck. An expanding fleet of smaller alternatives-from a ritzy river barge to a serene floating ryokan-are winning over travelers who prefer more-sophisticated and intimately proportioned sea voyages. The registered tagline for SeaDream Yacht Club, which has two 112-passenger vessels you can privately charter for custom itineraries, does not mince words: "It's yachting, not cruising."

title: The Paranoiac Reason Rocker Noel Gallagher Got Rid of His Laptop
summary: The leader of '90s Brit-pop band Oasis-whose latest solo EP, 'This Is the Place,' is one of three he'll release in 2019-talks favorite guitars, worthless drum machines and why he can't stand wireless headphones. I swear to you, once you're playing the app's sounds in the studio, on big speakers, you cannot tell the difference. So now I've got about 10 grand worth of drum machines that nobody wants to buy.

title: Murder or Mistake? Cop on Trial for Shooting Neighbor in Apartment Mix-Up
summary: Amber Guyger was off duty when she killed Botham Jean in his home, one floor above her own, inflaming racial tensions in Dallas. DALLAS-The trial of a police officer who shot and killed her upstairs neighbor after accidentally walking into his apartment began with prosecutors saying sexual banter between her and her work partner showed that fatigue wasn't the problem when she failed to recognize it wasn't her home.

title: VW Executives Charged With Misleading Shareholders
summary: Surprise charges upend Volkswagen's effort to move past diesel scandal. BERLIN-German prosecutors Tuesday said they have filed charges against Volkswagen AG Chief Executive Herbert Diess, Chairman Hans Dieter Pötsch and former CEO Martin Winterkorn for allegedly misleading shareholders in the months before the 2015 emissions-cheating scandal.

title: Freddie Mac Tests Software That Could Boost Mortgage Approvals
summary: Regulator recently met with housing-finance giant and the fintech firm behind the software. An effort under way at housing-finance giant Freddie Mac could increase mortgage approvals for borrowers who might otherwise be shut out of home buying.

title: Meet New York's Fitness Freaks
summary: An elite group of workout fanatics spends many hours a day in exercise classes. Like many New Yorkers, freelance producer Disco Meisch starts her weekdays with a morning exercise class-in this case a group treadmill workout at Mile High Run Club, a boutique fitness studio in Manhattan.

title: Bud Selig Grew Up With Baseball in His Blood
summary: The son of immigrants, the former Milwaukee Brewers owner and MLB commissioner developed a love for the 'undeniably American' game from his parents. Bud Selig, 85, is the former owner of the Milwaukee Brewers and was the ninth Commissioner of Baseball from 1998 to 2015. He is the author of "For the Good of the Game" (William Morrow), a memoir. He spoke with Marc Myers.

title: We Tried the New, No-Wash T-Shirts
summary: Made of natural-fiber blends, these tees purport to stay fresh for multiple wears. Our men's fashion editor attempted to make it through a month without stinking up the joint. "DO I SMELL?" Over the past month, that question ran through my head during nearly all of my waking hours. For roughly 30 days, I've worn three T-shirts that are marketed as needing less frequent washing due to their odor-resistant and moisture-wicking properties. Instead of relegating them to the hamper after one wear as I do with regular cotton tees, I shook them out, praying a few hearty cracks would eradicate city stenches and any armpit musk. For the most part, it worked: Throughout my month of stink testing, I never detected any foul aromas. And, yes, my nose works.

title: U.S. Home Price Growth Loses Momentum
summary: Average national home prices grew 3.2% in year ending in July, according to S&P Case-Shiller index. Home price growth is continuing to lose momentum, a boon to buyers who are also benefiting from falling mortgage rates and a trend that could help sustain the recent pickup in home sales.

title: Chinese Official Charged in Alleged Visa Scheme to Recruit U.S. Science Talent
summary: U.S. officials have warned that Beijing wants to exploit American universities in technology race. A Chinese government official and his allies allegedly tried to convince at least seven U.S. universities to sponsor visas for purported Chinese research scholars who in reality aimed to recruit American science talent, according to a recently unsealed criminal complaint filed by the Justice Department. They succeeded at least once, the complaint says.

title: The Risks and Rewards of Drawing Trump's Ire
summary: Resume Subscription. This item first appeared in the Capital Journal newsletter. Read today's full newsletter here or sign up here for daily updates in your inbox.

title: More Overtime Pay May Be Coming Your Way
summary: Where the Obama administration failed, Trump's Labor Department will expand who qualifies for time-and-a-half.. "Far and away the best prize that life offers is the chance to work hard at work worth doing," Theodore Roosevelt said. While he had a point, he left out another important aspect of putting in the extra hours-getting paid for them. Today, the Trump administration is making it easier for hard-working Americans to do just that. The Labor Department is publishing a final rule to raise the salary threshold under which all employees, regardless of occupation, are eligible for overtime pay.

title: U.S. Stocks Are Expensive, but for the Right Reasons
summary: Aside from the dot-com bubble, U.S. stocks trade at their biggest valuation premium over other markets since at least 1980. There are two beautifully simple explanations for why U.S. stocks are valued so much higher than equities in the rest of the developed world. First, the U.S. economy is doing much better than troubled Europe, aging Japan or Brexit-stricken Britain. Second, the U.S. market includes the FANGs of Facebook , Amazon.com , Netflix and Google, now Alphabet, while the rest of the developed world has few big companies with high growth potential.

title: Trump Heads Into 2020 Election in Search of a Blockbuster Deal
summary: On trade, guns and nuclear proliferation, the president has mostly been unable to strike the agreements he said he would.

title: Demi Moore on Writing Her Highly Personal New Book
summary: Cover story: In Demi Moore's new memoir, 'Inside Out,' nothing is off limits. From her transient childhood to her high-profile marriages to her addiction issues, the actress tells all-and explains what it was like to share it with her daughters. Demi Moore has eight well-behaved dogs, most of them rescues, all lap-size, none excessively yappy. At feeding time, each waits patiently as its silver dog bowl is filled from a tub of what one of Moore's assistants explains is "human-grade" chow flown in from out of state. It's good to run in a movie star's pack.

title: Demi Moore on Writing Her Highly Personal New Book
summary: Cover story: In Demi Moore's new memoir, 'Inside Out,' nothing is off limits. From her transient childhood to her high-profile marriages to her addiction issues, the actress tells all-and explains what it was like to share it with her daughters. title: Stocks to Watch: Netflix, Google, BlackBerry and Overstock.com
summary: Some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively include American Express, which announced a 10% dividend increase. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Tuesday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours; premarket trading is specified separately.

title: Pot Investors and Consumer CEOs Are on Different Trips
summary: Global brands are unlikely to make takeover offers for cannabis companies any time soon. The pot industry hasn't experienced the global takeover wave many investors were hoping for-and probably won't for the foreseeable future.

title: U.S.-China Trade Tensions Jeopardize Rollout of Self-Driving Vehicles
summary: Proposed U.S. limits on sharing technology with China threaten to stifle work at companies with operations in both countries. Proposed U.S. controls about sharing technology with China threaten the development of self-driving vehicles, an area where U.S. and Chinese businesses have grown to rely on each other in recent years.

title: As WeWork Stumbles, Its Smaller Competitors Cash In
summary: Knotel has pushed its valuation to more than $1 billion; some startups highlight partnerships with landlords. Some of WeWork's fast-growing competitors have been raising money and expanding in big cities by persuading investors and clients how different they are from WeWork.

title: Activist Investor Targets Mall Owner CBL
summary: Michael Ashner, known for investing in distressed assets, has taken a stake in mall REIT CBL. An activist investor with a history of restructuring debt and forcing property companies to sell assets is targeting struggling mall owner CBL Properties .

title: Google Tries Hand at Apple's New Game
summary: Subscription-based mobile game services face a tough challenge. In tech, no good idea goes uncopied. Sometimes even before it is clear if the idea was actually good.

title: A Controversial Savior for Chinese Small Business
summary: China's plan to help struggling small businesses is failing, but tweaking an older product could be a solution. China's plan to help struggling small businesses is failing.

title: E-Commerce Fulfillment Specialist Deliverr Adds $23 Million in Funding
summary: The Series B funding round will help add workers and warehouses to a burgeoning logistics ecosystem fueled by online sales. E-commerce fulfillment technology startup Deliverr Inc. raised a $23 million funding round to hire more engineers and other staff as it scales up its fast fulfillment programs for online sellers, the company said Tuesday.

title: Fighting SEC Over Cryptocurrency, Kik Shuts Chat App
summary: Canadian social-media company lays off most of its staff as it fights U.S. claims that it illegally raised capital. Canadian social-media company Kik Interactive Inc., which is fighting U.S. claims that it illegally raised capital, said it would shut its messaging app and lay off most of its staff.

title: China's Labor Market Is Changing, but It Isn't Because of a Trade War
summary: President Trump says U.S. tariffs have thrown millions out of work, but Western economists point to relative stability amid a shift to service jobs as the two sides prepare to resume talks. ZHUHAI, China-President Trump says U.S. tariffs are battering the Chinese economy, throwing millions of Chinese workers out of jobs-and pressuring the country's president, Xi Jinping, to strike a trade deal.

title: Some Real-Estate Developers Embrace Short-Term Rentals
summary: New condos target owners receptive to renting out units; some buildings to have hotel licenses. Property owners have long worried that short-term rentals bring noise, crime and regulatory risks to their buildings. But some real-estate firms are starting to embrace the presence of itinerant guests.

title: Drugmakers Lobby Hard to Preserve Pricing Power
summary: Pharmaceutical industry attacks proposals in Washington that could cut deeply into companies' sales. Worried drugmakers are stepping up efforts to blunt proposals in Washington that they view as some of the most serious threats to their pricing power in recent years.

title: What's Next for Company Chatbots
summary: As the technology saves businesses money, they are exploring making chatbots better and putting them to new uses. Early corporate adopters of chatbots, finding that the technology has saved them money, are working to improve them and exploring other areas where they could be put to use.

title: Girls vs. Boys: Brain Differences Might Explain Tech Behaviors
summary: Recent research shows the brain's rewards regions activate when males crave videogames, girls face more depression when overusing social media. Many parents of both boys and girls have witnessed striking differences in the way their kids use technology, with their sons generally gravitating to videogames and their daughters often spending more of their screen time scrolling through social media.

title: EU Court Sides With Starbucks in Taxation Case
summary: Court said Margrethe Vestager's office failed to demonstrate that Starbucks had benefited from illegal state subsidies. Margrethe Vestager, the European Union's competition czar, suffered a setback Tuesday after the bloc's second-highest court said Starbucks Corp. didn't benefit from illegal state aid in its tax dealings in the Netherlands.

title: China's Central Bank Won't Follow Others in Easing
summary: People's Bank of China won't substantially cut required reserves or push interest rates below zero, governor says. BEIJING-The head of China's central bank said that the country's interest rates were appropriate and that it wouldn't aggressively ease monetary policy, even as other central banks lower borrowing rates in a bid to spur growth.

title: European Leaders Blame Iran for Saudi Oil Attacks, Urge New Deal
summary: Britain, France and Germany say it is time for Tehran to start talks on a new, long-term pact dealing with its nuclear, regional and missile activities. UNITED NATIONS-The leaders of Britain, France and Germany joined the U.S. in blaming Iran for this month's attacks on Saudi Arabia and said the time had come for Tehran to start talks on a new, long-term agreement dealing with its nuclear, regional and missile activities.

title: China's Tech Industry Brings Home the Bacon
summary: Gaming company NetEase is building a pig farm; e-commerce companies think they can use technology to raise pork output. Chinese technology companies are onto the next pig thing.

title: Budweiser Brewer Raises $5 Billion in Asian Listing
summary: Budweiser Brewing Co. APAC prices at the low end of an indicative range. The Asia business of the world's largest brewer raised about $5 billion in its second attempt at a Hong Kong initial public offering, just months after it called off a much bigger share sale.

title: SAT Scores Fall as More Students Take the Test
summary: Greater number of districts are offering tests free to students during the school day, creating a more diverse pool.

title: More House Democrats Back Impeachment Inquiry
summary: Freshmen lawmakers say allegations, if true, represent an impeachable offense. (Latest Updates: Pelosi to Announce Impeachment Inquiry of President Trump)

title: U.S. Seeks to Send More Migrants to Mexico to Await Asylum Hearings
summary: The policy change expands the government's 'Remain in Mexico' program. WASHINGTON-Nearly all immigrants who apply for asylum as families will be sent to Mexico to wait for their claims to be decided, acting Homeland Security Secretary Kevin McAleenan said Monday.

title: Insurance CEO Took Leave After June Arrest Following Traffic Incident
summary: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina leader has since returned to his post. Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina Chief Executive Patrick Conway went on leave after he was arrested in June after an allegedly alcohol-related traffic accident, according to the company and the state's top insurance regulator.

title: GM Furloughs More Workers as UAW Strike Continues
summary: Auto maker imposes fresh round of temporary layoffs on plant workers as labor dispute continues. A United Auto Workers strike at General Motors Co. appeared headed into its ninth day, in a work stoppage that has led to temporary layoffs for thousands of workers at GM facilities in the U.S. and Canada who aren't involved in the walkout.

title: 'Rio Treaty' Nations to Cooperate on Sanctions on Venezuela's Maduro
summary: Vote followed meeting earlier Monday by members of the Lima Group, which has called on the leader to resign. NEW YORK-Western Hemisphere nations voted Monday to employ a regional treaty to impose sanctions against embattled Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro, accusing his regime of criminal activity including drug trafficking and money laundering.

title: Two Mortar Blasts Rock U.S. Embassy in Iraq
summary: No damage was caused, but incident comes amid heightened tensions in the region. BAGHDAD-Two mortars were fired into the Iraqi capital's center where the U.S. Embassy is located, security officials said, an incident that comes amid heightened tensions in the region after the U.S. blamed Iran for attacks on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities.

title: SoFi Pays Clients for Unexpected Tax Hit
summary: Startup's robo adviser liquidated investments and saddled some clients with capital-gains tax bills. Social Finance Inc. is paying money to customers for unexpected capital-gains taxes after the financial technology startup pulled their money from Vanguard Group's funds into its own exchange-traded funds.
